StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Advanced Genome Sequencing Approaches in Gastric Cancer

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
Stephanie U Greer, Lincoln D Nadauld, Billy T Lau, Jiamin Chen, Christina Wood-Bouwens, James M Ford, Calvin J Kuo, Hanlee P Ji. Linked Read Sequencing Identifies Complex Genomic Rearrangements that Drive Gastric Cancer Metastasis. [Submitted to Genome Medicine]
S.G., J.C. and H.P.J. were supported by a Research Scholar Grant, RSG-13-297-01-TBG from the American Cancer Society. H.P.J. received additional support from the Doris Duke Clinical Foundation Clinical Scientist Development Award and a Howard Hughes Medical Institute Early Career Grant. We also acknowledge support from National Institutes of Health Grants Digestive Disease Center DK56339 (H.P.J.), P01 HG000205 (H.P.J.), NCI Innovative Molecular Analysis Technology 1R33CA1745701 (L.N. and H.P.J.), NHGRI R01 HG006137 (H.P.J.), NCI Cancer Target and Discovery Consortium U01CA17629901 (C.J.K. and H.P.J.) and K08 CA166512 (L.N.). L.N. received additional support from an American Society for Clinical Oncology Young Investigator Award. Other support came from the Gastric Cancer Foundation (H.P.J. and J.M.F.).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (PUB, NPU, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-PUB-NPU-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
